title: BAE Systems brings South Korea’s Hanwha into intelligence-gathering constellation
key_assets: ['Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) technology', 'Ultra-wideband radio frequency (RF) technology', 'Azalea intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) constellation']
summary: BAE Systems and Hanwha Systems have announced a partnership to explore integrating Hanwha’s SAR technology with BAE’s RF technology for the Azalea ISR constellation. This collaboration follows a prior agreement with ICEYE, which is still contributing a SAR satellite for the initial cluster. Financial details were not disclosed.
why_it_matters: This partnership strengthens defense and commercial space collaboration between the UK and South Korea, expanding capabilities in multi-sensor satellite systems for military and disaster response applications. It also highlights the growing international interest in SAR and RF technologies for ISR constellations.
